medical_history.chief_complaint: Recurrent bouts of rhabdomyolysis associated with muscle weakness and high creatinine kinase levels.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Rhabdomyolysis episodes began at age 23 with neuroleptic malignant syndrome and have recurred during flu-like infections, with one asymptomatic episode post-anesthesia. Symptoms were associated with myalgia and muscle weakness, with CK levels reaching as high as 141,000 U/L during episodes.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Schizophrenia diagnosed at age 23, recurrent neuroleptic malignant syndrome, and documented stroke-like episodes with neurologic deficits over several years.
